channel.title: Steam Summer Sale 2012
channel.description:
Since no one felt compelled to start the thread, I decided to do it.[/SIZE]
[COLOR='Green']Steam Summer Sale 2012[/SIZE]
[b][COLOR='Green']The Community's Choice[/SIZE][/b] Head over to the [url='https://store.steampowered.com/']store front page[/url] to vote for which deal you want to see next.
[b][COLOR='Red']Flash Sales[/SIZE][/b] Limited time Discounts, get them while they last.
[b][COLOR='DimGray']Badges[/SIZE][/b] May or not be related to the sale. Steam have now added Badges to your steam profile, read [url='https://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=2799155']this thread[/url] to learn more.
[b][COLOR='RoyalBlue']Hidden Gems[/SIZE][/b] The guys over at [url='https://forums.steampowered.com/forums/']SPUF[/url] is already making a list of good lesser known games with discounts in the '[url='https://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=2799277']Hidden Gems of Summer Sale 2012[/url]' thread.
Let's use this thread to discuss the sale.

item.title: Steam Summer Sale 2012
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
Those multiple installs are normal, something to do with microsoft D3DX.

As for your problem, check DI forums or tech support.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Summer Sale 2012
item.dc:creator: Gasher
item.description:
Hmmm… I don’t know Siggs and Maxey… Everything else I own in Steam loads startup shit and saves etc pretty snappy-like – whether it be Dead Space 1 or 2, Portal2, all 3 Crysis, Metro2033, Assasins Creed… If I remember correctly though, Dead Island installed yet another copy of DirectX 9.x - and it isn’t the first game to do this… and some games install another copy of MS Visual C++ Redist… I have a bunch of these installed.

So I wonder: could multiple copies of DirectX 9.x and/or Visual C++ installs mess things up at all for some games? I am running on a auto-updated Win7 Pro x64, which I assume has DirectX 11, right? Anyone have ideas? I want to play this dang Dead Island some, but the loads make it almost unbearable… so I have been sticking with my wonderful new Crysis games for the time being.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Summer Sale 2012
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Gasher:

OMFG!!!.. I bought Dead Island today for ten bones… I have never, ever dreamt that a fucking game could take so long to load… er… anything. And I have a monster dual-processor w/ 12GB and a raid. I didn’t time it, but it must take like over 4 minutes to load a level… eeks! Shit, it takes well over a minute just to quit. I never heard of this piece-of-shit Chrome engine before… now I know why. Though, the game itself is not too bad. Very different from L4D. I do enjoy being a lone wolf for a change. I’m just not sure I would have bought this farkin’ thing if I knew about loads. Maybe games should start getting disclaimers… similar to prescription drug commercials!

lol, ragewall. THere’s something wrong with your PC/install, is that not blatantly obvious.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Summer Sale 2012
item.dc:creator: Assassin
item.description:
Dr. Karamazov:

My bank blocked my creditcard because I used it to by Metro2033 for $3. Apparently spending $3 sends of the alarm bells and they assume that my card has been stolen.

Of course! If I were a criminal who had stolen a creditcard I too would look for cheap games on Steam.

Ahaha.

So far I have bought;

Crysis
Crysis Warhead
Crysis Wars (wtf is this?)
Skyrim
Metro 2033
Dawn of War 2
Dawn of War 2; Chaos Rising
Dawn of War 2; Retribution
Space Marine

I’m now going to glue my bank card to my wallet in an attempt to stop buying shit.
Unless Empire Total War comes up for $2 of course…

want dawn of war in coop?

Read full topic
